value.label: Contractors - Difficulties in attracting or keeping contractors or tenders including architects, builders, traders people and industrial problems.

Approved Provider - Organisational death or incapacity of proprietor, restructuring, change of key staff involved in decision making, organisational mergers, sale or purchase of age care facilities affecting the provisional allocation.
Finance - Difficulties obtaining finance for construction.

Land - Land originally estimated to be suitable but later discovered to be unavailable, eg: bushfire regulations, too close to environmentally/culturally sensitive or hazardous sites. Or, no suitable land to be found at acceptable price.
Planning - Applications for building/development approvals to local government authorises and appeals to other agencies as results of decisions lengthy process in regard to resident objections etc.

Priorities - Concurrent refurbishments: additional places being allocated in subsequent rounds requiring re-design, combining provisional allocation construction with refurbishment, That is, other projects happening at the same time.
Site Problems - Physical site problems and weather conditions delaying construction process. Included sites found to be contaminated, on flood plains, subjects to heritage restrictions etc.
Other - Other reasons, mostly minor delays. Could also include problems in securing agreements to work.
